Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kallesandstrom
Reviews.Content: A somewhat late review of what was a very pleasant stay. My better half and I stayed at Cram over Christmas 2011 and were very pleased with the hotel. It is very boutique with a nice design feeling to it. Though a little cramped in terms of space in general, it was of little concern. We had a standard room that was very clean and nice. Upon asking at the front desk we were provided with the complementary wifi password and bathrobes. The staff was very nice and helpful. The location is good; close to many restaurants and city attractions. The rooftop is very nice. However, the swimming pool is more of a decoration. Also, good room service. The only reservation we had was the bathroom door. It was made of glass and didn’t close tight.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: marcodimero
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Hotel Cram and thought it was an excellent hotel. No problems at all from me and particularly enjoyed the decor. Located not far from the centre in L'Eixample, everything is in walking distance but if you can't be bothered there's a metro nearby. I thought the room was excellent with a wide-screen TV and very modern bathroom with walk-in shower and lighting system. The roof-top terrace has excellent views out across the city and up to the mountains and the bar downstairs is very trendy and not too expensive. I did avoid the Gaig Restaurant however which is situated in the hotel as 60 euros for a main isn't what I want to pay as much as I like fine-dining and it does have a michelin star. Unfortunately Barcelona is a dangerous city and I was attacked in the main square after leaving a club and refusing to hand over my wallet. I was found unconscious at the bottom of a flight of stairs leading to the metro in Placa Catalunya and was out cold for five hours. Apparently the only reason I'm alive is cos I fell sideways and not backwards. The police were very concerned and were a big help and very re-assuring but there are gangs waiting to rob you at night all throughout the centre. My advice is don't under any circumstances get separated from whoever you are travelling with as my friend also was mugged hours before I was but had the sense not to resist. The hotel staff when they found out were very concerned and apologetic but at the end of the day it's no ones fault except those guys who did it. Overall I'd advise anyone travelling to Barcelona to stay at this hotel but don't go out at night alone, don't hang around Placa Catalunya and the Barri Gotic if you don't need to and leave any valuables in the safety deposit box and only take out the money you'd need that day/night which is what I did so they didn't get anything.

Reviews.Title: “If it's free it is ok!”
Reviews.Author: agasstuff
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cram has great location, you can move from there to the center without problems. The breakfast service was ok - delicious food + wonderful view. The biggest minus was dirt. There was a lot of dust everywhere. I wasn't pay for the residence, but if I had to pay that money - I wouldn't be happy to see dust flying all over the room.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: Eleonora-FI
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Barcelona with my mother, and our plan was to have a comfortable room with nice breakfast and a location from which we can easily walk to most places we wanted to go to. We didnt't have anything to complain about Hotel Cram. The regular prices were a bit more than we might have wanted to pay, but since it was rather quiet time of the year we got a nice "pay 2 stay 3" deal and it was actually quite reasonable, especially in comparison with other similar hotels in the area. The staff is friendly and as already mentioned here, english speaking. The hotel is very clean and the room confortable, although rather small. However since we mainly wanted a room for sleeping and resting a bit during the day, it was well enough. Comfortable bed, nice bathroom. Free wi-fi. The breakfast was included in our offer, which made the price even better - the breakfast buffet was very good. The location is also very handy. Although we took a taxi from the airport, it would have been easy to come by train or bus. We walked to most places (as we both like to walk a lot), but subway's just a few blocks away. We also recommend a restaurant called Flauta nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: CharlesRoberts
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, English speaking staff that made you feel welcome. The room was comfy if not a little bit too modern for my liking. Breakfast I thought was a little expensive but as I eat enough to cover lunch it wasn't to bad and the view was great. Inter net service was free and good.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: umami5
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Cram last weekend for 3 nights. The hotel is a very modern style and has a real feeling of class about it. We didn't spend much time in the hotel but the rooms were very comfortable and looked very cool. The T.V did not work and they could not fix it for us but did offer to room move us (as we didn't really need the T.V this was not a problem for us so we stayed). 5/6 minute walk from the parc.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Katyj505
Reviews.Content: So my bf and I were originally going to stay at the W as that is our style and normally we stay there if there is one in the specific city we are staying however I did a bit more browsing and found this place and I have to say, I'm SOOOO HAPPY we did! It's so chic and trendy on the inside and the rooms are cute, on the smaller side but good for a couple or solo. The bathroom was fine and there were Bvlgari toilettries. We also got welcome champagne free (2 glasses) and the 2 guys at the front desk were so helpful with everything! room was very clean and location is great, cabs are super cheap!!! I DEF reccomend staying here, esp if you want a nice place in a good location for a cheaper rate. This was about half the price of W! So glad we stayed, it's also a few blocks from all the shops, had a nice little shop and spa day! Bed was sooo compfy too and there even was a balcony you could stand on. :) STAY HERE IF U COME TO BARCELONA!

Reviews.Title: “Water problems”
Reviews.Author: Canadawestwoman
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I must concur with what many of the other reviewers have said. We stayed here at the beginning of October and, although the location and decor are excellent, we had no water for 24 hours plus WiFi connection was either non-existant or very poor.The hotel staff kept telling us that all would be fixed...so perhaps, by now, it has been, but I would get this in writing BEFORE booking a room. They did give us a small refund for our inconvenience and we found the staff to be very polite in spite of the stress they must have been under. One question: whose idea was it to put a glass door on the bathroom? This is the one room where most people want privacy. It was very awkward when we invited 4 friends to come for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rapt0r
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. Great staff. extremely modern and clean rooms. Good location for exploring the city from. Close to the buss mstops and metro. Be aware that breakfast was not included in the room rate and i had to pay extra for that. i would definately stay there again when I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: upfrontIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights.Clean well laid out rooms.Helpful,civil and informed staff.Good extensive breakfast.Great location for walking to city centre.Ideal base for city break.Would have no hesitation in revisiting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MateoW
Reviews.Content: A fun hotel, rooms a bit small but well appointed, stylish, and well kept - not a problem in terms of size. The hotel conveniently houses Gaig Restaurant, an excellent restaurant with superior service and food (Michelin star) and Chef Gaig WILL come out to every table to assure all is well - haven't seen that for a while. The hotel location is excellent, walkable to many of the places you'll want to go in Barcelona and the Metro or buses will get you to anything else easily. The hotel is in a fun area, close to the University (and more), so there are plenty of things happening all around. The hotel service was very good, helpful, and even a recommendation one night for a restaurant nearby (one never knows how a hotel recommendation will work out) led us to a very good spot a few blocks away (La Carmaga - excellent fish dishes and more). Our room was on the forth floor looking out onto the busy intersection below - but the french doors let no noise in when closed, so it was nice to step out onto the balcony to see what was going on, and be able to close the doors to keep the city out when desired. A very nice 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “over priced”
Reviews.Author: wayne m
Reviews.Content: stayed nov 17 for 4 nights , on arrival told my 14 yr old son could not share room age limit is 3,had to pay for additional room , no tea or coffee making fascilities in room , roof bar had to go to ground floor bar each time we ordered , air conditioning min temperature set to high . nice rooms , could not get internet access . great location over priced

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: LisaandMike88
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed (party of 6) The Cram very much. Small but clean rooms, with great soundproof windows! The rooftop deck was a bonus for late night chats and a cool view of the city. Very good location for getting around. The front desk staff were very polite and helpful. We enjoyed our stay at The Cram for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Staff. Not worth the $”
Reviews.Author: MikeandAshley529
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, I thought this hotel was a nice and positive place to stay. I was here on the weekend visiting a friend in town, and the hotel provided an excellent location, and the style was right up my alley. The staff were always exceedingly friendly and helpful, so I really don't have anything bad to report about that. It was comfortable and very clean. However, there are some downsides. I think it is a bit pricey for the space, and there were some unfinished areas of the bathroom (paint chipping, an unfinished ceiling to the shower, etc). I think for the money, the hotels should hold a better standard, and the room size was kind of small (smaller than the photos on here!) I know it is a Tablet hotel, (I am a Tablet Plus member so I know what I am talking about) and usually the Tablet hotels hold a higher standard. I think if you are interested in a design savvy boutique style hotel, this is an nice choice, but I don't think it lives up to the price tag for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: IgorZet
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel only if you prefer design over comfort and service. I've chosen this hotel because of the previous reviews and location. But the location was the only satisfying thing. When we arrived we saw a nicely designed hotel, but the longer we stayed, the more angry I became. Good: - Design. The hotel really looks like every detail was created with purpose and everything is designed in style - Location. In the middle of Eixample. We didn't used any transportation at all. Almost all tourist places are reachable by walking. Bad: - Bathroom. I was surprised to find out that the bath tube, which is mentioned on hotel's site, exists only on some rooms. My room had only shower, which doesn't make it 4 stars hotel. - Internet. By all standards it is NOT high speed WiFi. The signal was unstable and some times didn't work at all. I complained at least several times and the and the answer varied from "we will check, in can't be possible" to "yes, we know there is a problem, but technician will be here only tomorrow morning" - Working area. They have a nicely designed working area with the table you open in the cabinet , but ... no one thought about chair. You could only sit on the bed to work with your laptop, which is very uneasy. - Tourist amenities. It's very strange, but they don't have any tourist information available. - Service. Practically non existent. Starting from that every time I tried to complain about something, I didn't get any proper answer and ending with the fact, that twice during my conversation with the front desk, manager interrupted it in order to reply his phone, making me wait. Also, they had a pipe leak and switched off the water supply for the entire hotel every day of our 4 days stay. We didn't receive any apologies for it as well as every time I asked when they solve the problem, no one could provide an answer. So, my conclusion - the hotel does not worth to be called 4 starts hotel and I would not stay or recommend it to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Worst!”
Reviews.Author: Kais34
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this hotel is the location and the modern decor. My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon 2 nights ago and had the absolute worst experience. First to give you some background on our knowledge for Barcelona and hotels in Barcelona. We both lived in Barcelona for a yr, have studied in Barcelona and visited our favorite city many times in the past so I know what I am talking about when ranking this hotel. I had researched this hotel and read all of the reviews before booking it and now wonder where all these people stayed at because this hotel did not live up to any of the expectations. First upon arrival they changed our room from the 3rd floor to the 2nd floor which I later found our was due to the fact that the 3rd floor had a water pipe leak and they had moved other customers into our room. Second due to the 3rd floor water pipe issue, our room on the second floor didn't have ANY hot or cold water for our entire stay. The hotel did nothing to fix this even after our many complaints. The manager told me he would call our room which he never did, once the problem was fixed. We asked to be moved, which the people at the front desk said was not possible and offered a 25% discount on our room. On top of not being able to shower for two days, not being moved into another room and only being offered a 25% discount, our air conditioner also did not work at all. Once we found this out I asked for a full refund and explained that I would rather stay in a hostel with running water and air conditioner. Upon hearing this the incompetent assistant manager was only able to offer a 50% discount as he did not have the power to make a full discount to us until his manager was there the next morning. On top of this the hotel's WIFI doesn't work at all and the hotel staff was unable to provide a solution. This was the absolute worst hotel experience I have ever had, and I have stayed in boutique 4-5 star hotels all over Europe. This hotel should not be ranked as a 4 star hotel. Literally the only thing nice about the hotel was the central location. However, there are many other options with comparable location and price in Barcelona. This hotel ruined the end of our Honeymoon and I will never recommend this hotel to anyone I know or stay there again. The staff is completely awful and did absolutely nothing to attempt to fix the situation let alone give us a refund and help us move to place with AC, internet and running water hot or cold. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT stay at this horrible hotel it is not worth the money or the head ache.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Viajerosin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cram Hotel for 2 nights. It has a boutique hotel feeling and is very modern. The beds were comfortable, the windows were sound proof, the bathrooms were unique but not very practical though. The hotel is located in the Eixample district, very nice location and safe. It is 4 blocks away from Casa Batllo, one of Gaudi's pieces of art. It's also close to Casa Mila and La Sagrada Familia. They have free Wi-Fii and offer breakfast at the top of the hotel but it was not worth to pay. We found a cafe next door which offered a similar selection for half price. There is a City Tour Bus we took a block away from Casa Batllo. They have 2 routes, one takes you to the main Gaudi's master pieces and the other to Park Montjuic.

Reviews.Title: “Very tiny rooms, nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: fijigirlprincess
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel with a modern twist, although even for a European hotel I found the rooms very small. Hardly room to move around the bed, although I have to applaud the way the rooms have been designed to take advantage of every square inch of space within. Big drawback is the lack of privacy for the bathroom - my husband and I have been married 11 yrs and still didn't have as much privacy as I'd like for the loo. The bathroom door is a combination clear & frosted glass (yikes!) and has a lot of tile floor to ceiling (no sound privacy either). Fine for our one night stay but I wouldn't have been comfortable here for longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel, Best Location, be Smart Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: MissieMom07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for first 5 nights of our Spanish vacation. The neighborhood was great and the area was really safe. The Universitat metro station on the red line is a short 5 minute walk from the station which is essential when trying to get around Barcelona. The restaurants around the hotel are great ant not marked up like in the Barri (Gothic) Distic and Los Rambles area of the city. Plus Passaig de Garcia is just a 10 minute walk from the hotel and has great shopping and food as well. We loved our room yes it is small but not for a European hotel by any means. We stayed here as a 25+ married couple and loved the young vibe of the hotel, American’s think the W without the price tag. If you were traveling with a family it might not be for you. The roof top pool was amazing, you could see the whole city) as was the room décor and the balcony overlooking the front of the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone even considering it was amazing and the staff was great anything we had questions about they had answers and a smile. When we came back to Barcelona from Mallorca we stayed by the Harbor and were severely bummed out coming from such a great hotel and safe area of the city wish we had stayed at Hotel Cram again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Larzon67
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights at Hotel Cram and loved every minute of it. Been coming regularly to Barcelona for 15 years now and this is by far the best place we´ve stayed at. The rooms are modern, well kept, very clean, beds are extremely comfortable and rooms are quite spacious. The staff in the reception is probably the best we´ve ever met, professional and friendly. Never been to a hotel where the staff says hi to everyone who enters the hotel or passes the desk. But at Cram, they always says "hola" ! But the hotel could do a better job with the pool area and the rooftop bar. The inside of the bar was too hot (how about a/c?) to stay in and the pool was out of order for all 10 days. But we did not care that much as we always went to the beaches... Hope Cram keeps up the good work and give the rooms the update that will probably be necessary in a couple of years or so...

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Msknights
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Cram for two night and three days in June. The hotel was very modern and dark inside to contrast with the historic building exterior. The room was small but, well appointed and had a fun flair with the light settings and modern decorating. The hotel is small and in a very safe neighborhood. This is about a 15 minute walk from Las Ramblas, where the main tourist info is located. The main drawback we found to this hotel was the staff. The help in the hotel lounge was very uninspired to serve. They had to be found to order a drink and were unhelpful. I ordered a round of drinks with the intention of going to the small rooftop. The waitress disappeared and after waiting about 5 minutes started to take the drinks with me to the roof. I had given her my room number but, she did not return for me to sign the receipt. I was planning on signing when I brought the glasses back and she was quite upset that I was going to leave before she got around to printing the receipt. We had drinks in the bar several times and found the same lack of service each occasion. The front desk staff was very friendly but, not functioning as a concierge desk. They were not great at advising on eating or tourist destinations but, were nice and friendly. An absolute must is eating at LaFlauta. It is only about 2 blocks away, has amazing service and the best meal we ate in our 10 days in Spain. The bill for 3 adults with wine was only 60 Euros. We were highly impressed. I would not stay here again but, was satisfied with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: langford62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days in July with my partner for a mix of business and pleasure. We found it perfect. A nice room, compact but well designed and a really comfortable bed. The top floor terrace had a small plunge pool and great views. The staff were wonderfully helpful and friendly. The location was excellent away from tourist trappings and central so we could walk everywhere. A great deal for a reasonable price. We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design, comfortable, with a few imperfections”
Reviews.Author: MikenDavid
Reviews.Content: Beautifully designed room, with curved walls and smart use of mirrors to expand the space. Modern design with warmth and sense of fun. Nice wall textures. You feel you're in a place where modern hip hotel design is important to the operator. Pre-set room lighting scenes that are fun and useful. When you open the room door, the room lights come on, immediately setting the mood. Very comfortable bed with quality linens.  Lots of storage so you can get the suitcase and stuff put away, which is important in a high-design minimalist interior. Be careful: the hot water is really hot, and is immediately available, which is not always the case in many hotels! Continental breakfast buffet is available on the top lounge / pool level:  good selection in open air setting with fun views of the neighborhood. Free Wifi but didn't  work on our floor and when it did work in the lobby, only allowed email and not Internet browsing. No business center with computer for printing boarding passes, although desk personnel will go online and print for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: decky69
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Cram from Sunday to Wednesday. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location good for both shopping and the night life of the Ramblas. A number of good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting design at a good location”
Reviews.Author: Redstripe4
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, loved the deisgn, however I was not a fan of the glass door to the bathroom. It gave no real privacy, and another downside was that the room felt a bit worn out. Not unclean, just a bit worn out. Otherwise the room was spacious and very well decorated, and the staff was super friendly and helpful. It is a bit pricey, though, but all in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “funky hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: clare23
Reviews.Content: rack rate is very expensive, but internet deal made this a great value stay. roof top space great, really comfy bed. no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very design”
Reviews.Author: Chris-Grace-NYC
Reviews.Content: I came for a business trip and was booked in this hotel. Though I usually don't fancu design Hotels, this one was simply fantastic. The rooms were well appointed and the staff helped me with logistic problems. Always with a smile, I never felt I bothered them when I steped to the Reception for the fifth time that morning. The location is great, it took us just a few minutes to get to the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “good spot”
Reviews.Author: roge79
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the wknd @ start of April. If you're coming in by airport bus the closest stop is the "universitat stop." However if its your first time to barca probably best getting off at place d'catyluna as this is where the tourist las ramblas is located and were you'll be spending most of your time. The hotel was very chic and dark, the beds were comfy, rooms were small but comfortable, the shower was a walk in shower with overhead waterfall shower head which was great. The roof top breakfast bar is small but views are good, the pool is basically a large bath on the terrace and is slightyly disappointing. the neighbourhood felt safe, 10 minute walk to las ramblas. staff friendly enough but the porter was a bit creepy tho but did the job well!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wonderful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Valentina__Ts
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for 3 nights. It is comfortable city hotel. The location is good, you can reach the main streets in 5 minutes walk. The breakfast variety is not too big but it is amazingly good! We recommend it for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: golulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband. Positives were lovely room, big comfortable bed, lovely bathroom with large rain shower, mood lighting in room was nice touch and worked fine. Not many negatives but the staff were not overly friendly, but that did not bother us too much as we did our own thing. The bar is so quiet and dark & feels a bit pretentious but we did have a drink one night and felt relaxed in the atmosphere. It's about 10 minute walk into the centre of the city which suited us fine. Overall I would recommend this hotel, you will definitely be comfortable here, even if it does lack a bit of busy-atmosphere, but the decor makes up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Good...”
Reviews.Author: Rudolf_CRO
Reviews.Content: I was the whole week staying there. The hotel is cozy, trendy, and nice. It is clean and comfy... Breakfast very good, but small "breakfast room" with a nice terrace overlooking Barcelona roofs... There is a pool, but I would call it a bath tub due to the size. Staff good, nothing extra. Surroundings with plenty of small restaurants. I would say it is a bit overrated but in general good...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: suttoncoldfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, couldn't fault it. Staff were very friendly @ helpful

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: 186338Simonc
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel cram - exceptional service from all the staff throughout the hotel, great rooms, good location, relaxing terrace - would highly recommend this hotel in barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service above and beyond from hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: jogerard
Reviews.Content: Aside from being a very modern boutique hotel near Passeige de Gracia, the staff we met - Daniel, Shawn, Jordi, Chris and Gemma went beyond the call of duty in helping us out of some difficult situations. They were also terrific in mapping routes to places we wanted to go to and suggesting amazing foods to try and the best restaurants for finding it. Kudos! The Ottiers

Reviews.Title: “Modern, very clean, comfy!”
Reviews.Author: eabs2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cram was VERY cool. The bathroom (room 307) was super clean and the shower had an overhead rainfall shower, as well as a handheld piece. Loved it! Great toiletries that are restocked every day. Very soft white towels. Cool roof area with a great "lap pool." Very small but very hip. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bedding was VERY clean-- and I am extremely picky about that. There was 1 channel in English, so that was a relief. The buttons on the nightstand for lighting were confusing- and I'm 26 and tech-savvy. But easy enough to figure out if you push all of them enough. The lounge near the reception desk was really cool- lots of magazines, super comfy chairs, a bar. Great wine selection! The restaurant is Michelin-starred and we went one night for dinner. It's almost too quiet in there, but the food is awesome. And they give you plenty of little complimentary treats before and after your meal. Incredibly nice staff. I left my camera there when I checked out and they saved it for me and mailed it back to me in Austin. How great is that?! If you go here, avoid Las Ramblas. The hotel is walking distance to La Boqueria though, which is SO cool! I definitely advise people to check out the little area of town where Santa Maria del Mar is. That was my favorite part of Barcelona. L'Olive is near the hotel and a great restaurant. The only cons were that the a/c wasn't amazing (but hey, it's Europe) and that the bathroom floods a little if you take too long of a shower. And the Internet in the room isn't wireless- you have to plug in. And it's kinda slow... but get off the internet and go check out the city anyway! Overall, awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a no frills, modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: broadwayron
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I only spent 2 nights in Barcelona, but we were very happy with Hotel Cram. The front desk employees were extremely helpful (and nice), and spoke English, which was a big plus for us. As others mentioned, the room is small, but well laid-out (there was even a sliding drawer under the bed for large suitcases). The balcony we had on the 4th floor offered an ok view, and noise was not a problem. The room was very clean and modern, and the free wifi was a nice touch. My only compliant is a minor one... the shower looked cool, but the way it was configured, it was impossible to not drench the bathroom floor. And, the breakfast was way overpriced (so, I guess that's two). But those are minor in the grand scheme. Actually I think the hotel was our favorite part of Barcelona; yeah, the city is pretty, but we live in NYC, so it was a bit boring. And, on Sunday, it's like a ghost-town. As a side note- we took the train (the station is very close to Cram) to Sitges, and had a blast. That's a great little beach town- highly recommended. Try it, when nothing in Barcelona is open on Sunday. But, I would definitely stay at Cram again, it was a good deal, all-around.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, Top Class”
Reviews.Author: sailorpete67
Reviews.Content: Older Hotel has been totally modernized in the latest high-tech furniture and equipment. Very clean and comfortable, Stayed for one week and will come back in the near fiuture.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: gerhel
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome from staff at reception . The room was a bit small but well appointed and spotless. We had to ask how to access the wardrobe for hanging clothes as the TV hung over it! You have to move it on its rollers along the top of the cupboards. We were not keen to do this in case we broke it. Breakfast is served in a glass- enclosed balcony overlooking the city. It is continental style only but well laid out and of good quality. The rooftop pool is a tiny rectangle beside it. Two people and it would be crowded. Breakfast cost us 21 euros each. Next time we eat out. Our room was on the first floor overlooking a busy intersection but the soundproofing was excellent and the curtains when closed completely darkened the room and this meant a good night's sleep. All the adverts mention slippers and robes but there were none supplied. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: adl72
Reviews.Content: Rooms a bit small - probably the reason for the name Cram (them in!)... Nice design. TV system was being changed so only had terrestrial channels - no English channel. Good central location. Room had balcony onto a noisy street, but double glazing kept out most noise. Staff very friendly and happy to help. Didn't do breakfast, but coffee and croissant at many cafes around for just a few € better value.

Reviews.Title: “Gay Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: polofson
Reviews.Content: Fabulous and friendly. Rooms very modern and comfortable. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “modern updated hotel”
Reviews.Author: chess88
Reviews.Content: very good location, trully appreciated the friendliness of the reception. Their recommendations made our trip perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice style”
Reviews.Author: leaolima
Reviews.Content: Very nice trendy hotel. The building is very stylish. The atmosphere is trendy. Facilities are not enough for such hotel. Breakfast is supe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: stephvol
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cram was great! Located in a safe nighborhood with very clean rooms, small but very modern, comfortable and we only slept there so didn't need anything bigger. Great neighborhood, walking distance to La Rambla, the cathedral, etc. Very nice English speaking reception with great recomendations for restaurants in the area. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: zmm1985
Reviews.Content: this hotel was amazing!! the rooms where gorgeous and we had a balcony facing out onto the busy road but was not noisy at all, the bathroom was gorgeous!! the showers where walk in dual rain showers! there are robes/slippers provoded and an adequate mini bar, i found the staff helpfull and not too pushy, there when we needed them but otherwise not, the restaurant downstairs was lovely and the pool and bar upstairs was gorgeous!!! there really is only one negative in that it is a little walk in to the main centre on barca and to the beach ect but it is close to shops/restaurants and far enough to be out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NYC329
Reviews.Content: Perfectly comfortable rooms. Walk up to the Universitat metro station and take the red line tour bus from nearby Plaza Catalunya. Via Diagonal(the shops) is a must. Gaudi's spectacular homes are there and the truly fantastic Museu Egypto is in the area. A beautiful city and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just another hotel”
Reviews.Author: pavjm
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Cram, was not really an experience to define - the staff was friendly, the hotel in a decent location - wasn't terribly overpriced, but it definitely did not feel like a 4 star. The room true to the name of the hotel was "crammed". There was very little space in the rooms and we kept falling over each other or the furniture or our own luggage! the View was incredible - the windows opened into the neighbours' balconies!! The rooftop swimming pool was certainly a joke. The designer lighting in the room could get rather painful if you had to locate something you lost. Tip: If you do have to stay here - ask for a bigger room (i guess they'll charge a lil extra for that) But they did try really hard to make good use of the space they had and designed it as interestingly as they could.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bklynite
Reviews.Content: The name says it all: Cram. The rooms are small! (Although the bathrooms are big.) But that's a minor issue. So what if they aren't huge? Our room was clean, modern, and comfortable, with ample storage space, and a balcony. The bathroom was white with a great shower. Travel toothbrushes, soap, and other toiletries provided were really great. We stayed at the hotel twice, each for one night, about a week apart and were in two different rooms. One was in the back on the second floor and very quiet. The second was on the fifth floor overlooking a busy street, but thanks to a double-paned balcony door the room was very quiet. We're a young couple and found the room to be perfect for us. The location, while not all that close to La Rambla, was perfectly fine. (Given the noise on La Rambla, some might choose a hotel such as this for the relative quiet!) The hotel is merely four or five blocks away from Passeig de Gracia and its major sites: La Pedrera, Casa Batllo, as well as the Metro stop linking you to most of the city. Very close to the University as well. The staff was very friendly, helping us with directions, restaurant recommendations, calling taxis and more. We did not choose to have breakfast included with our room rate, saving us about 20 euros per night. It was probably a wise choice because there are plenty of cafes within walking distance of the cafe where one can get coffee and pastry before starting the day. I recommend this hotel for short stays -- three nights or fewer -- as the size of the room might not be enough if you wanted to come back and relax after a busy day of sightseeing. The rooftop deck and lounge was nice. The pool was small, but refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “I don't get the Cram... Cramped more like...”
Reviews.Author: Ladymann
Reviews.Content: This is another of the hotels that designers have never had to stay in. The rooms are standard, tired and in need of the designers again. This time, perhaps more focus will be paid to the needs of the traveller. There are better value stays here and glad that it was just one night. The staff are great though but this is all fur and no <fill in the gaps>.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel although shame about a few things...”
Reviews.Author: xxx_Jay89_xxx
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner both in our 20s stayed here in August 2008 and loved the city. This hotel itself is very modern and just a 10 minute walk from the Ramblas. A perfect central point and has many restaurants and clubs nearby. The rooms were ok a bit small but loved the 2 person shower ;) - We had a few problems with our sink and tv and the staff were very slow to assist. The breakfast room on the other hand I thought was good, it overlooked Barcelona and provided a good variety of choice, only shame was the pool is very small and was more for decor than to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in an innovative hotel”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller360
Reviews.Content: Don't expect the super perfect location at the Ramblas and don't expect oversized rooms. But this hotel gave me good value for the price. Cool design, innovative rooms and free internet, movies etc. Staff was really helpful and you can have free Nespresso in the Lobby. I like!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JordanSofia
Reviews.Content: Designer hotel,very modern and luxury.the room was too small.in the hotel have restaurant with" mishelin" star.

Reviews.Title: “A favourite hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: kangi
Reviews.Content: We like The hip, slick and fashionable decor The weird shell shape of the internal balcony The staff of the reception, knowledgeable and extremely helpful The rooftop with the stamp-size swimming pool that creates some atmosphere in any case The minimalist breakfast you can have on the rooftop We don't like Rooms are so small you have to store your bags under the bed (this is true also for superior rooms) Is not particularly close to the centre It can be really noisy, as it is at a intersection of two large roads.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: filoderba
Reviews.Content: really tiny room for a exaggerated price. dark hotel, depressing breakfast room. conceited.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LelaM
Reviews.Content: It's another of the design hotels in Barcelona where a little more humility could help. The rooms are relatively quiet (ask for one at the back if you can't bear street noise!) and modern. The breakfast is a ripoff at Euro 21 per person (really!) but there are plenty of places around to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel - quiet yet close to all”
Reviews.Author: Michal4444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 2 years ago, but the hotel was so new that I'm assuming nothing has changed. We enjoyed everything about this hotel. The modern design is beautiful and makes for a really special atmosphere that conbributed greatly to our feeling of vacation and being in "another world" (a very well designed one). We felt pampered with plush robes in our rooms and all of the necessary goodies that only hotels that really want to pamper their guests have. The location is excellent - on one hand a bit removed from the hussle and bustle of the Rambla and the noisy touristy areas so it's very quiet and fun to come back to after departing from the noisier streets, but it's still walking distance from everything. Also, if you have a Tapas-overdose as I quickly did, we found the most amazing Italian restaurant that was truly one of the best culinary experiences I've ever had. The restaurant (which can almost only be found via word of mouth - though it's cenrally located, it's entrance is almost secretive and one would most likely not stumble across it without looking for it). The restaurant is called Da Greco, you can read a bit about it in this link: http://www.bcnrestaurantes.com/Eng/barcelona.asp?restaurante=da-greco . You need a reservation. Also one more tip - one of their main courses is a pasta tasting dish where you get a few different types of pasta - order this, it's out of this world. And leave room for desersts - the desert chef is the owner's son who came from Brooklyn, NY and the desert menu is entirely American deserts, including the most amazing NY cheescake I've ever had. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and perfect”
Reviews.Author: PALOMA2
Reviews.Content: Very well located, friendly staff , and great great design hotel. All the furnitures and decoration are modern and minimalist. The TV in the room is amazing, includes DVDs ready to watch and internet ( wireless keyboard) - everything included. I strongly recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE DON'T STAY THERE!”
Reviews.Author: leocook
Reviews.Content: There are better more affordable hotels in Barcelona than Hotel Cram. It advertises as a 4 star boutique hotel which is a joke! The place is falling apart, tv's that don't work, sunloungers that are falling apart, over priced food & drinks, the list goes on. However i will save the best till last, i booked this hotel specifically so that we could chill by the roof top pool and catch some sun before heading back to the UK. When we arrived the pool was closed as is looked more like a pond than a pool! The terrace was also being vanished. We were assured that it would be cleaned and usable in the morning otherwise we would have changed hotels. By 5pm the next day the pool was still filthy! All day we tried to hunt the manager but all he did was dodge us unntil we refused to pay on check out, then he suddenly appeared! He then proceeded to call the police aswell as ranting and raving and accussing us of lieing. 4 of barca's finest turned up to sort out the mess!!! DON'T STAY THERE PLEASE IT'S COMPLETE RUBBISH!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WesleyEllul
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing... Central, gorgeous, friendly staff, wicked rooms... everything you could want. The look is ultra chic but the rooms are well priced. just 3 blocks north of Universitat stop and 3 blocks west of the northern part of ramblas, it is located in a perfect place to have a great holiday. The rooms were fab 32 inch Lcd's in the standard room all with FREE internet on the tv, and free on demand tv and movies. The furniture was all the latest chic designs with a bathroom to match. Far from small the room was perfect for those who will use the room to relax in between excursions around the city. A triple a Plus from me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: IssyMP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Cram. We were looking for a hotel which would be near the city centre but not noisy or too touristy. The hotel is in a classic building but is modern and is only 5 minutes walk from the university and 10 miutes from las Rambas. So an easy walk to see the sights and go out at night. The rooms are fairly spacious and there is plenty of storage. Every room has free internet connection and a great selection of films on demand for free. The beds are comfy and the shower gorgeous. On the roof is a small swimming pool (about 16 foot by 6 foot) but it is enough to cool yourself off in and sun loungers after a hard day sightseeing. There is a bar there as well but it wasn't open late when we were there. We didn't eat breakfast but it is served on the roof and looked nice. There is also a very reasonably priced Michelin starred restaurant on the ground floor. The staff are friendly and the place is spotless. I couldn't recommend a better place to stay for a relaxing, fun, holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brymay
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week's stay at Hotel Cram, Barcelona. We got a fantastic rate through www.tablethotels.com, which may have influenced our positive attitude towards the hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and knowledgeable. They provided good advice on everything we asked and couldn't have been more helpful. The decor was modern, well designed (I am a designer myself) and spotlessly clean - if a little frayed here and there. The rooftop pool is small, but as large or larger than any other rooftop pools in Barcelona that I encountered. It has 8 sun beds and plenty of tables and chairs. Also an outdoor shower. It is a fantastic facility and we appreciated being able to cool down and relax after a morning's sightseeing. The rooms are certainly as large as any standard rooms in a 4 star in Ireland. There was plenty of storage and the free movies, games, information and internet access (via the TV and wireless keyboard) was a bonus for siesta time and for browsing information on Barcelona. The location was perfect - within walking distance of many attractions (including Casa Bastillo, MCCB, etc), very close to the Universitat Metro and lots of bars and restaurants. We tried 'Flaut' (mentioned below) and loved it for the great tapas and food. Also recommend 'Origins', which is nearby for fantastic tapas and Spanish produced ingredients. 'Teller Tapas' is another fantastic restaurant in the locality. For good food further afield, try 'Shoko', Paseo Maritimo de la Barcelonetta - fantastic Asian cuisine in a great restaurant in the trendy beach area. Have a fantastic outdoor lounge area for after dinner drinks overlooking the ocean. Another favourite was 'Cuines Santa Caterina', Av. Francesc Cambo in El Born - bustling, great food and fantastic atmosphere and choice. Make the effort to visit Sitges - a small coastal town about 30 minutes by train from central Barcelona. Bustling, great beaches, places to eat and people watch. Well worth the effort and a nice break from city life. Is a very gay friendly area. If you're visiting Sagrada Familia or Museo de Picasso get there early as the queues are extraordinary and difficult in the heat. I would highly recommend this hotel - it provided everything we needed and the rooms were much larger than we were expecting due to earlier reviews. I'm not sure if I would have been giving such a glowing report had we paid the full rack rate - but if you look around, you'll always get a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelsing
Reviews.Content: Good location in Eixample, clean rooms but very small even by European standards. CNN and BBC only English Channels. Staff friendly but not very knowledgable about the local area. When we asked for a gym nearby they advised they had "Passes" for a Health Club, 5 minutes walk. When I asked if their were any other "gyms" in the area they said no. So we got a "Pass" each day although the Health Club was not what we really wanted. On our last day we found a "gym" 10mins walk which was part of a very large Spainish chain. When we checked out the bill included Euro 10. for every "Pass" to the Health Club, we had assumed the Passes were free as at no time were we told we would be charged. The charges were eventually credited after we complained. The "Rooftop Pool" is a lap pool with two sunbeds. The glass bathroom door is two thirds frosted the rest clear, and does not "seal", not very effective in insulating noises or odours. Although the stay was OK, I would look to stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Barcelona Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stephsel7
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but very modern and clean. The location was great...walking distance to many great restaurants and to all of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed as lamb!”
Reviews.Author: jobymaloby
Reviews.Content: The website is certainly better than the hotel. This really is a very standard hotel with a a thin veneer of "boutique" applied to it. The rooms were tiny for the money (€194 per night). The concept of having lighting so low throughout the hotel that you can't read anything, is not really what constitutes a boutique hotel. The TV system repeatedly didn't work and I had to get front desk to reboot it a few times and when I woke in the morning for a shower, I found that the whole hotel had no running water. This took a good forty minutes to get fixed and meant I was late for the meeting I was there for. I certainly wouldn't stay there again. At that price, there are far better in BCN. Style over substance!

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Clarie
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why it took me so long to write this review - My friend and I stayed at Hotel Cram in September last year for a three night city break and had an absolute ball. As creative professionals, we fancy ourselves quite picky about where we stay, and only booked the Cram because we got a fantastic deal on Tablet Hotels (it had only just opened). When we got there we were delighted - The glass entrance leads into the lobby where every surface seems to be shiny and brilliant. The bar is something else - a myriad of textures and shapes, not to mention the FABULOUS mojitos! The tantalising of the senses continues into the bedrooms. Ok, they aren't huge, but we found our room more than adquate for our needs. The bathroom was excellent, the shower ran the full length of the wall and there were plenty of lighting options meaning optimum make-up appliance. The only downside I would mention was that the bathroom door is see-through (ok, frosted but you can see everything that's going on) and without a lock. And the loo is beside it. We found it quite funny but I don't think I'd feel the same if my boyfriend had been there and not my best friend! A highlight was the roof terrace where we enjoyed a midnight swim on our last night and wished we'd thought of it sooner. Although at the time we stayed there the decking was not completely finished, and there were several workmen during the day who's oggling cost the Cram it's full 5 points. I would love to go back again to experience the Cram in all it's completed glory, if only to see The Most Beautiful Man In The World TM again at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great location, excellent staff! Top-notch all the way.”
Reviews.Author: ChasssTO
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cram was in a marvelous location and was a lot of fun! The staff was very attentive and extremely helpful and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “be careful with reserving through Tablet Hotels”
Reviews.Author: robjc123
Reviews.Content: This hotel - will not refund a dime if booked through Tablet. Please note is not Tablet that charges you but in fact the Hotel. I am unable to travel to Spain b/c the Spanish Embassy here in the US can not give my Cuban friend a Visa appointment for over 3 mos. When I spoke to Silvia at Hotel Cram she informed me that they will not refund my room. (they will sell it though to someone else since they know I canceled the reservation) The entire rate will be charged to me 1 month from now. Plenty of time to sell the room. They will not refund me any money. We are talking hundreds of Euros! Do not stay here! They are not reasonable or honest people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barossap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from October 21st. WE arrived late but that did not present a problem and we were efficiently checked in by efficient and friendly staff who were extremely helpful throughout our stay. The hotel is a 15 minute stroll to the Ramblas and 5 or 6 minutes from Gaudi's Casa Batllo and the designer shops in that area. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel but used a fantastic cafe 2 minutes away and enjoyed fresh orange juice, croissants and small, beautiful french stick sandwiches with our coffee and the bill was never more than 13 euros for two. We used the same place for a lovely chilled Cava too, great value with 2 glasses of Cave and two red wine costing 7 euros. There is a super restaurant attached to the cafe, cheap, great choice, excellent value and good food. The rooms were excellently designed. The bathroom boasted the world's best shower and the lighting, whilst not the easiest to fathom produced some lovely calming combinations. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would certainly recommend the hotel for anyone looking for a quality place in a good location of the city.. It also has a starred and famous restaurant too although we did not try it.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Travel Inn.”
Reviews.Author: Gingermum
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cram is a beautifully designed up market Travel Inn. The TV in our room went wrong everyday and the service was slow in trying to help. Even though it was on the junction of two very busy streets, there was very little noise and the hotel was quiet. The air conditioning was effective and the bed was very comfortable. For the price I feel that breakfast should have been included at 18 euro for 4 of us, we opted to eat out. Comparing this to our last hotel in, supposedly expensive, Austria I didn't feel that it was particularly good value. The worst thing about the hotel was the non lockable glass door on the bathroom-absolutely bizarre!!! Getting the right combination of buttons to switch the lights on and off was an adventure worthy of launching the space shuttle. All in all a pleasant enough stay but definately not great value for money. The area that the hotel was in was safe enough at night and busy with tourists and locals alike.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: goldie98102
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last part of our honeymoon in Spain. We couldn't have been happier with the place. It was clean, chic, and modern. The first room we were in was a bit small, but the hotel had cleverly designed the rooms to maximize space (i.e. rollers under the bed for your suitcase). We transfered to a bigger room when the internet in our room didn't work. The hotel ammenities were wonderful. HUGE TV with free movies, free internet. Hotel roof is great, bar was comfortable and had good wine. Room service was tasty. We didn't go to the hotel's restaurant, but its reviewed very highly. The location was great (about 3 blocks to Universistat metro), and 5 from Passieg Gracia. Tapas bars were close by. We loved it here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mullacrew
Reviews.Content: This was by far an amazing choice of hotel. Designed on the colours of tibetan monks, this is an absolutely gorgeous, romantic hotel. It's all very dark, which adds to the mood. From you walk in the door the decor is just beautiful......we went for a superior room and it was fab........curvy walls......large lcd television on the wall, balcony, mood lighting, great storage area for luggage, brilliant air conditioning, free movies, free toiletries (right down to the toothbrush and toothpaste!).........the toilet had a frosted glass door which was partially unfrosted so you would want to be completely comfortable with your companion.......luckily it wasn't an issue for us. The restaurant is supposed to be amazing but we didn't try it as there was a lot of fish on the menu and we are not fish eaters. The bar was pretty quiet but is decorated beautifully. The only drawback is that the staff have a pretty poor grasp of the english language......but i wouldn't let that put you off. It is located about a 7 minute walk from the Ramblas area so it's a perfect spot. Overall, we were delighted with our accommodation and if we return to Barcelona we will definitely be staying in Hotel Cram again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern sexy hotel”
Reviews.Author: desperados
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, from the moment you walk into the dark and elegant reception you are made to feel very special. The rooms are dark and sexy using dark woods and orange, most rooms seem to have a round feature wall inside them which appears to be the bathroom of the room next door, very different and very cool. The room has all the gadgets a boy could wish for, wall mounted 32"lcd with free films on demand and internet, a complex lighting arrangment that allows you to turn off and dim all the lights in the room with a chrome panel on the bedside tables. The shower in the bathroom is a huge walk in affiar with the shower head being about 30cm in diameter dropping out of the celing. What is also strange is the building seems square on the outside but the area around the rooms make you feel like you are in a vertical tunnel, but not in a bad way in a very cool way. We never tried the restuarant so cant really comment on that, it was the menu that put us off with pigs trotters and Brain Salad! The main parts of Barcelona are all in an easy walk of around 10 mins the port is about 20mins. The only problems we had during our stay where to do with the new swanky TV system , we had to change rooms after first checking, in as the tv would not turn on and then in our other room we had a few problems accessing some of the films. But im sure these where just the intail teething problems and have probably been sorted out already.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been so much better”
Reviews.Author: 356boy
Reviews.Content: This is certainly a stylish piece of design and should have been an enjoyabe stay. The rooms are small - but its forgivable. The service is terrible - and is not forgivable. I booked an executive suit as I needed to work for some of the time I was there. On arrival the wifi advertised in room was not working, it took them 4 days to fix it blaming the bank holiday. The manager was on holiday for the first few days of my stay and I was told there was no one in charge in his absence! the desk staff prefered to argue with me over the broken wifi some how implying that I wasn't entitled to it in my room despite advertising it on their website. When I explained that I wanted to work in my room on the terrace the receptionist asked if was a spy in a highly partonising manor. I left the hotel extreemly agrovated by the entire stay. I have stayed in 2 star hotels with better service. This hotel has poor infrastucture and resources to maintain its facilities. My suggestion to look at one of the other excellent hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at the Cram”
Reviews.Author: Tr0uble
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having been to Barcelona before so knew that the location was good and a great place from which to explore all areas of the city. I read numerous reviews on this website and others so was of course a little concerned at comments about small rooms the a glass bathroom door! However we were pleasantly surpirsed on arrival. The room was adequately sized and well laid out which gave the impression of more space. It's very modern and has that 'new' feeling although some parts of the bathroom has already started to look a little worn (chipped glass around the bottom of the sliding shower door) although the great overhead shower more than compensates for this! The glass bathroom door was not an issue as it was at the far end of the room, most of it is frosted and you just have to respect your partners privacy! The hotel does lie on the junction of 2 major streets so comments regarding the street noise while the bedroom window/door is open are correct, however this is not an issue if the window is closed and the air conditioning works very well. The interior of the hotel is nicely designed, very modern, dark and sultry and the exterior is very elegant. The bar area lacked atmosphere but maybe due to being slightly out of season. The bar seems mainly used for people visiting the michelin starred Restarant Gaig which is inside the hotel. We called on the staff a couple of times to sort issues in our room (problem with sink) and they came quickly and sorted this out. They were friendly and always said hello when passing reception. The pool and roof terrace were closed during our stary probably because they were doing work to it before high season. All in all, I would certainly use this hotel again and would recommend it. Placa Catalunya is just 10 minutes walk away to the south and the elegant areas of Gracia are on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Cram at Cram”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSims
Reviews.Content: amazing location .. very chic ... Modern well designed aesthetically ... some major build quality issues .. steamed a jacket in the bath room using the shower, and shorted out half the hotel .. From that moment on you couldn't use any electronics in the room without the same effect. Some rooms are much smaller than others and at the same price. But the staff were helpful; even giving me a free room when I returned at 4 am to find I had .. yet again .. no electricity. (this is also how I learned about the larger rooms). I liked that most of the guests were europeans. I liked that I fit in whether I wore Prada or Camper, and I loved that I could walk anywhere, and everywhere, but cabs were a cinch when I need one

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, hit and miss service”
Reviews.Author: AllanBLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Cram for 5 nights in April '07 in a standard room. It wasn't my first choice of hotel but it was almost half the cost of the other hotels that I was looking at and that in the end was the deciding factor. The hotel itself is very nice. The bar / lobby area is actually quite beautiful and well designed. I was also impressed with the room which was nowhere near as small as I expected. It was well designed and there was a large bathroom with an amazing overhead shower. The hotel provides free wireless and broadband and free movies etc which was a good bonus. Despite all that I would hesitate to recommend this hotel. Although some of the staff members were really helpful and nice, others were the exact opposite and my overall impression of the service is negative. For example, it was my birthday while there and my partner got me a birthday cake and surprised me with it in the room. To our amazement however, room service and then reception refused to bring us some plates and forks to eat it unless we ordered some food. We were told it was against 'hotel policy' to provide plates!!! Breakfast was nothing less than chaotic and frankly a nightmare. The staff were completely disinterested and we felt like we were disturbing them. One morning there was no coffee / juice / milk until 20 minutes after we arrived. Although the area the hotel is in is good, just outside the main tourist areas but with a local feel, the hotel is located on the junction of 2 main roads. Although there was no noise in the room when the windows were shut, it was completely impossible to leave your window open at all. On saying all that the hotel was very good value for money. Over the five nights we saved quite a lot of cash, but if going for a shorter time or if money is not a consideration that I would say stay somewhere else (namely Casa Camper!!). Allan - London

Reviews.Title: “Little rooms but quite nice..”
Reviews.Author: Arturas
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights at the hotel. I liked the location ( a lot of nice restaurans in the neighborhood). The hotel self is modern, nice designed but the rooms are small. Breakfast location is quite dark but they do have enough choice of food to start the day... Swimming pool was closed... Nice hotel if you spend lots of time outside the hotel and only use hotel to sleep and shower... And who wants to spend the whole day in Hotel when you are in Barcelona...

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Excellent Staff, Good Location in Eixample”
Reviews.Author: rrgg
Reviews.Content: Ultra-modern yet very warm, with a lot of nice touches in the room. My standard double room had a very comfortable bed, large flat screen TV, large bath with overhead shower, and unique styling. Staff was excellent, well dressed, and spoke perfect English. Hotel has wireless internet and provides loaner laptops if you need one. Michelin rated restaurant (did not get to try). My room had excellent sound insulation. I was on a corner facing the street and was never disturbed. The rooftop pool is a huge plus if you want to cool off at the end of the day (although it closed at 8pm). Not all hotels in the area offer this. For location, it's just a short walk to trains and Las Ramblas. Casa Batllo is only a few blocks away and it's a bit further to La Pedrera and Sagrada Familia. I also considered the Axel which is just a few doors down, but this was much cheaper at the time and I definitely feel it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: jjm79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Cram for 4 nights in Feb - Thurs - Mon. The hotel is housed within a period building, but inside is ultra modern. First impression was very very good, although in time we felt that the hotel in general (rooms and common areas) was a little dark. That said, all the decor was slick and fresh and felt fairly up-market. The rooms well definately compact, but well designed, with ample storage space. We certainly didnt feel claustrophobic. One bonus was the media centre in each room which comprised a flat screen tv and wireless keyboard. Whilst most channels were spanish speaking, the free broadband internet on offer and free movies were welcome. The bathrooms were well equipped, stylish and with modern fixings. Although neither of our rooms had a bath, which didnt bother us, but if youd like a bath be sure to ask for one. The rooms were cleaned well and beds turned down again in the evening. We found staff to be very polite, friendly and helpful. One disappointment was the lobby bar though, which was rarely staffed. The restaurant Gaig, is michelin-starred and we had a fantastic meal. At 75 Euros each it wasnt cheap but did feel very exclusive. The hotel is well located, being 5mins walk from Passeig de Gracia and about 10mins from Placa de Catalunya. On the downside, the hotel is on the junction of 2 busy streets, although neither of us struggled with noise (if youre sensitive about noise ask for a room overlooking c/ Aribau as its the quieter of the two streets). Ive posted photos of my room and the lobby, but to be honest, the hotel's own photos give a better idea of what its like in reality. If we were coming back to Barcelona and staying somewhere in Eixample, we'd def consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “A lil' "CRAM" as the name suggest”
Reviews.Author: luxetraveller
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1. Bargain at Euro 125 per night for a standard double. 2. Modern with plasma screen with a mac mini attached... but wait... Negatives: 1. The nice plasma TV did not actually work - we asked the front desk to repair it but they did not even bother to send anyone to fix it, which takes me to this hotel's biggest flaw... 2. Service is non existent - when you approach the people working at the front desk for some advice or question - they act like they are doing you a HUGE favor...... 3. FYI if you would like to go to they gym, they are affliated with "Holmes Place" gym nearby but you are expected to pay for it. 4. As per title of this review - double room is tiny, you even have to store your luggage under the bed. 5. Location a little secluded - although it's 10 - 15 mininutes walk to the shopping areas at the Passeig Gracia, some who may prefer to have everything on their doorstep may prefer to stay at Hotel Omm or other hotels in that vicinity. We also stayed at The Grand Hotel Central in the Barri Gothic area (see review) Restaurants: Tried Cinq Sentis nearby - great food, especially the dessert and very reasonably priced. Atmosphere was a little sterile though. Moo (at Hotel Omm) - not worth it, food that tried to be too inventive but for all that effort it was not tasty at all... kind of like the decor of the hotel resaturant and lobby ...

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable, so stylish, so don't want to see/be seen on the toilet....”
Reviews.Author: DVG1
Reviews.Content: So comfortable, so stylish, so don't want to see or be seen on the toilet.... can't fault the (slightly small for superior) comfortable , modern & clean room, very insulated, huge bed, interesting mood lighting control - great fun until you want to make your way to the bathroom in the night & you hit full on search out & seek button... staff discrete but smiley, never the annoying knock on the door....... didn't try the breakfast as there's just too many places to try in BCN seems a crime to stay in your room/hotel - so generally the ONLY down side is the bathroom - not the generous shower - though really would have expected a bath as well in a superior room - it was the fact that it is opposite the bed with a frosted glass door which has a clear panel about a third of the width which gives you a great view of the toilet...!!! very odd - would anybody want this ?

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomas-TRIP
Reviews.Content: we are a couple from southtyrol (nord italy), sorry if you find some errors on the langueges. we was in the hotel cram from 26.12.06 until 30.12.06 before booking we looked this website and we find very different oppinons for the hotel cram and the negativ comments make our decissions very difficult. Now that we are back home we are verry happy because the hotel cram was perfect. the staff was very friendly and they respect all our desire. The room (508) was beautiful design, we find very warm collors; we did'nt hear the traffic noise and stayed confertable. The badroom was large, cleen and had big shower. If we come back to barcelona for shure we chooise this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nicely designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: absf
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be getting some mixed reviews, but my overall impression was very positive. This is a trendy, boutique hotel. While the rooms were small, they are well designed and very comfortable. The solid, heavy windows blocked out any traffic noise from outside, and I didn't hear any noise from other rooms or the hall, but I also didn't see many other guests. The large, wall mounted LCD screen provides internet, on demand movies (including adult), and regular TV all included in the room rate. Some of the technology is a little on the new and untested side, however, and my TV turned itself on at 3:20am. Then the flashing blue light on the mini-pc behind the monitor, but reflected in the mirror was driving me crazy and I had to figure out how to power off the PC. There were also problems with picture freezing when changing TV channels that required a reboot. Bathroom was very modern. Excellent water pressure from both a ceiling mounted showerhead and handheld one. Bathroom door is only frosted glass with an unfrosted strip, so anyone that needs to feel privacy from their roommate may not like this. They provide some nice extras like mini toothbrushes and paste, strawberry glycerin soap (I wasn't crazy about it) and lotion. The lounge area looked cozy and inviting, the music was good but there was no one there everytime I passed. It was mid-December, perhaps a very slow time. I didn't need to interact too much with the front desk, but they were very nice on check-in and checkout and always said hello when I came or left. I got a good rate (€110), and think it was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: ssssh
Reviews.Content: This Hotel according to U.S standards would not be rated 4 Stars..it's Clean..it's Average, but there is a lot of Less costly hotels that are Clean and Average in a 3 Star. The Hotel personnel lacked that Friendly Approach towards the Guest nor were they helpful. Would I recommend this Hotel? NO...not for the Money. On the other hand if the Room Rates were much less...then I wouldn't expect much, therefore I'd say Yes.

Reviews.Title: “could be a lot better”
Reviews.Author: lacika34
Reviews.Content: Yes, the Cram Hotel is a very well designed hotel, obvious effort was done as far as the look of the lounge, the corridors are concerned, and really looks like a 4 start hotel. Unfortunately the receptionists are ice cold, they seem they could not care less and you get the impressions you may be bothering them. When you finally get to go up to your room, you arrive into an incredible heat in the corridors. It is like the subway in Paris. The room surprisingly small, although we had reserved a superior room with balcony and view over the city. Upon inquiry, the receptionst coldly explained that they took the liberty to downgrade our reservation, for we opted for a double room. And they do not have double superior rooms, or so he says. The room itself was not to tidy, cracks on the walls, dirt stains, etc. The thing advertised as swimming pool on the roof is hardlw one. It is rather a bath for birds. The expensive breakfast has nothing to do with the quality expected from a 4 star establishment, very boring, but at least the staff here is very friendly. The pros: the location: not in the immediate center, so it is rather calm. The coffee on the roof was rather nice. Also, the multimedia plasma screen with internet acces in the room is a good idea. If ever you decide to go to this hotel, search for a promotional offer, for the real price is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “class hotel in a safe very safe area”
Reviews.Author: roundtower
Reviews.Content: On arriving at our hotel we were made very welcome by the receiption team who very professional in all aspects .The room while compact was excellently laid out and the was cleaned daily and the queen size bed was turned down nightly which was a nice touch.The bathroom large and very modern and overall no complaints could be found with with our room. The hotel was only a 10 minute casual walk to Plaza Catalunya where all the tour buses could be got and it was also the starting point both for the Rambla and the Gothic area and the main shopping area Passeig De Grasia. I would recommend this hotel for any couple who wishes to explore Barcelona . M.H. Oct 19th 2006

Reviews.Title: “Designer Hotel with NO customer service”
Reviews.Author: karenodk
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a wonderful couple of days in Barcelona. On our second night we stayed at Hotel Cram, it is a designer Hotel in central Barcelona. The staff were very unfriendly and appeared to be very inexperienced. Firstly our micochip card didn't work so we had to go back down to reception to get it replaced, no apologies were offered. Secondly we couldn't find the climate control switch and the television because it was a PC as well as a TV we couldn't tune it. Four Telephone requests a trip to reception and one hour later we were sorted out by one cheeesed off employee. The bedroom was very compact. Water in the mini bar was €4 a bottle. The swimming pool was on the terrace, which was very compact and was almost in the bar, there was no privacy and was most unattractive for swimming. Breakfast at € 18 per person was totally over priced, don't go for it. In short Hotel Cram is overpriced, badly staffed it definately gets a thumbs down from me.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend - Hotel Cram - from Dublin couple”
Reviews.Author: blushingbride
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about location before arriving at Hotel Cram - as last time I was in Barcelona - we stayed just around the corner from La Ramblas - but the reviews and photos of Hotel Cram were soo good - I thought it would be worth the risk. And the risk paid off - it's about 8 min walk to La Ramblas and Placa de Catalunya (which, by the way, this is where you can grab a tourist bus to see the city sights in one go for 18 euro per adult) - so it was no big deal at all. We took the Aerobus from Airport and hopped off at Barcelona Universtat (a couple of stops before final stop) - you literally cross the road head towards the university and walk up street called Aribau - 3 blocks and the hotel is on your right. My first impression of the hotel was "mm looks cool" - very mod and kinda funky. The staff were very friendly and made no fuss about our early check in. First impression of the room was that it was small but it was very clean, very modern and had everything you would need. The bed was very comfortable and yes I agree with previous reviewer the pillows were so comfy. The bathroom was great - loved the rain style shower and the heated mirrors. I agree with previous reviewer re frosted bathroom door - could be a little embarrassing for people who aren't totally comfortable with each other!! Not much privacy. All in all - I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and tell them to ask for a bedroom at the front - better view - noisy but windows drown out traffic at night. Good air con system. A word of warning.... you'll do lots of walking in barcelona... so be prepared for sore calves!! I'd recommend doing a bus tour (Red Line) to visit to Parc Guell, and Gaudi's unfinished Catherdral Sagrada Familia - worth seeing. Shopping is great - Zara Mango H&M, System - very good value. Eating out in Tapa Bars is a much and so cheap. Oct was lovely time to go - T shirt weather - and not as crowded as summer months. Enjoy Placa Catalunya

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up For The Cram”
Reviews.Author: OhYes!
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to return to Barcelona after a great trip last year, but rather than rent an apartment again (which had it's pitfalls), we elected to try a hotel for a change. After reading various reviews, my wife seemed set on the Cram although were disappointed to find many online booking companies said the hotel was full. She contacted the hotel directly on the off-chance and to our delight they confirmed they did indeed have a room free and charged roughly the same rate as was being suggested through third-party companies...this might be worth remembering. We took the AeroBus from the airport to Placa Catalunya, firstly based on cost (4 Euros each) and also that our hotel seemed close to this area on the map. We obviously got our map-reading wrong as it was a good 15 minute walk (mostly uphill it seemed!) to the Cram from the bus drop-off point and it seemed worse in 25 degrees heat carrying bags and suitcases. In hindsight, we would now have got a cab. But, albeit a little sweaty, we made it to the Cram and were delighted with the cheerful welcome and helpful staff. The hotel looks and feels very high quality as soon as you step inside.
