The rooms have recently been upgraded technology wise and now feature a PC-based communication and entertainment system that is clearly impressive. Via the 32" wall mounted LCD TV, you have movies on-demand, full internet access via a wireless keyboard, about 30 Spanish tv-channels (plus CNN/BBC), Barcelona guides and history all on-screen and even some music choices to set the scene for you. Better still, all of this was included in our room rate with no additional charges for any aspect, even the movies. However, a warning. The system is new and is experiencing teething problems presently. In room 209, the wireless keyboard didn't work (no internet), the TV kept freezing up and when it did work, half the screen was fuzzy. We pointed this out and the staff were so helpful, finding us another room to move to where everything worked adequately, but we still experienced a few issues. Also, there are several hard-core XXX movies available in the movie-list to watch and although we eventually saw a parental lock-out facility, it wasn't apparent initially and could easily be overlooked....if you take children, be very careful. We're not prudes, but couldn't resist a quick look at these movies and even we were mildly shocked!! :-) Despite the teething problems, this is clearly a superb facility and I personally found it a godsend to keep up to date with my UK football news! The rooms are adequately sized and beautifully decorated, very modernistic and high-tec. The air conditioning worked flawlessly and the moody lighting pre-sets were very useful! The bed is huge and as someone else said, the pillows were so comfy. The bathroom is nice too, although perhaps suffering from some minor design flaws. You seemingly cannot avoid flooding the floor after a shower as the slide doors do not seal. I slipped on exit on the soaked floor and almost had a nasty accident. The glass door to the bathroom is frosted glass, but also has a strip about 4 cm wide down the edges with clear glass.....you can see right in. My wife and I weren't fazed by this, but some people might be. There really is no bathroom privacy whatsoever and there may as well be no door there at all. The swimming pool....oh how we chuckled! Again, through lack of proper research, we were of the belief that (perhaps like some UK hotels we are used to) there was a nice big pool on the roof to swim in and laze about by after a hard days walking. Erm...it's tiny, about three times the length of your average bath. Also, if you do use it, you have to walk through the bar/eating area lobby from the lift and back again, possibly dripping wet. Not ideal and from our perpsective, a bit awkward. Despite this disappointment, we saw the funny side of it, it was our own fault for not picking up on this. The breakfast was included in our rate and was (to us) very continental and not to our taste. That's us being picky and fussy though, as all we could stomach was croissants and coffee and as a result, the cost was not worth it. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby that can provide a wide variety of food for less then half the cost. There is also a full room-service facility, which we decided to utilise due to there being no coffee making facilities in the room. Two coffees duly arrived about 20 minutes after ordering......TEN EUROS - OUCH! The hotel's adjoining restuarant was highly recommended by many to us, but as we were on a budget, we didn't try it out. I can confirm it looked and smelled good though! On one long walk back from Placa Reial to the Cram at about 2am we were confronted by a sinister looking chap who tried to accost my wife. The streets were empty and dark due to the Cram's location and therefore another warning....late at night, get a cab back, don't walk it, it feels very unsafe indeed. Our view is that it really is a couples hotel, perhaps geared at the high-tec modernistic younger couples as well. We loved it despite the negative comments above, mainly because of how well we were treated by the staff and the facilities (except the pool!) that were available. We would go again, a little wiser now too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience but Couple of Small Flaws”
Reviews.Author: Cleargal
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel was excellent. The exterior is beautiful and the lobby is exactly what I love (very modern in style). The staff were very friendly throughout and made no fuss about our early check in. My first impression of the room was that it was small. Having said that after the first day I didn't notice anymore and it was well designed. The modern theme was continued into the room which I also loved (flat screen TV, choice of lighting schemes at the touch of a button, etc.). The bed was big and comfortable and the pillows were amazing. The bathroom was surprisingly big and well designed with a couple of nice touches like a rain style shower and heated mirrors. The shower was easily big enough for two. A word of warning though, the bathroom door is frosted glass so don't share a room with someone you might feel self conscious around. I was with my husband so all was fine but for a parent and teenager or maybe even a couple on their first overnight stay somewhere it would be a disaster, no privacy! The few negatives about the room were that although the fixtures looked lovely they were a bit shoddy. The toilet roll holder, the fridge door and the nightlight were all loose. The only other problem was the 'view'. We faced the back of the hotel and looked into the balconies of the apartments and houses behind. It was ugly but we kept the curtains drawn. On hindsigt we should have changed rooms but I just didn't think about it at the time as it wasn't a big deal. Ask for a room over looking the street and I saw some of the superior rooms had terraces which would be worth it. The roof terrace was nice to relax on and towels were supplied. Yes the pool is tiny but perfect for a quick plunge to refresh yourself after a day sightseeing. It is cold though! A nice touch was the chair lift into it for wheelchair users. I'd never seen that in a hotel before and it seemed very thougtful. I liked sitting there in the evening, cocktail in hand, looking at the castle lit up on the mountain and setting the world to rights! We walked everywhere but be warned your legs will get a work out so if you have any difficulty in mobility be prepared to call taxis. The Rambla de Catalyuna is only a couple of blocks and La Rambla itself is about 15min walk. The port is about 30min walk. A local place to eat that I'd recommed in Cerveseria Cataluyna but eat outside and expect to wait for a table (worth it). Don't have breakfast in the hotel. €18 a head is ridiculous and you eat so late at night that you'll still be full in the morning. Stroll down to Rambla 31 on Rambla de Catalunya for a croissant/something else sweet and coffee for only €3 a head. Fresh and delicious. I would recommend this hotel as a very good 4*. I would go back. I recommend it for couples and friends. Not families or people who have more traditional tastes in decor.

Reviews.Title: “Name says it all, you are crammed”
Reviews.Author: jsnellis
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cram is a lovely hotel, close to the main attractions of Barcelona; the staff are not particularly friendly... we had to wait 20 minutes to check in upon arrival. Our room was supposed to have a bath, but only 6 rooms have that. Every time you use the shower, the entire bathroom gets soaked, impressive design. The bed barely fits in the room, and that is pretty much all there is. If you like a modern, minimalist hotel, this is for you. It was clean, the closets very much like Ikea, etc... The one thing that we really did like was the cool lighting options, though not labeled. No alarm clock and no where to sit besides the bed. We will not stay here again, but some might like it - all will agree that you are crammed.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL HAD A WONDERFUL TIME!!”
Reviews.Author: mercedes50
Reviews.Content: We visited SPAIN , BARCELONA in June/July stayed in the CRAM HOTEL . I was extremly pleased. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. It's in a great location. There are lots of cafes and restaurans in the areas.VERY MODERN. I WOULD STAY THERE AGAIN.
